Design for Woven Fabric with Neoclassical Motifs

label: Description
value: Arranged vertically are two motifs (one is possibly an alternate suggestion).  The lower motif consists of a square with decorated subdivision inscribed into a circle formed by a chain.  Plants rise obliquely from the corners of the square, their tops being horizontally connected by a rosette and plant motif.  The upper motif consists of an arch of a garden of grotesque style, in which a square hangs low, into which a wreath is inscribed.  From the pole forming the base of the arch hang chain festoons and gems.  A lyre is shown in a circular medallion which is surrounded by stars in the upper part of the arch.  Squared with graphite.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on laid paper prepared with brush and brown pigment

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: The right half of a fantastical floral palmette, following the style of about 1730, is shown. A chain motif occurs in the place of ribs of leaves. Reverse: red strip along the left edge.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and white, brown, green, lilac, and red opaque watercolor (partly applied at the reverse) on oily traving paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for Woven Fabric with Neoclassical Motifs

label: Description
value: Vertical composition framed at upper and lower margins by horizontal plant motif set between two stars which frames the larger design to be repeated. The design consists of three parts: at bottom, a decorated lozenge with two kinds of palmettes; center, a palmette with rinceau calyx; above, a pole suspended with a bead festoon from which rises a fantastic blossom, all squared in graphite.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, graphite, on laid paper, prepared with brush and brown pigment and squared

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for Woven Corner with Neoclassical Motifs

label: Description
value: Vertical composition with two motifs rendered in white gouache--one circular and one rectangular--surrounded by stars.  The larger, rectangular motif consists of an oblong shape formed by boughs with a lozenge and palmettes inside.  The smaller, circular motif consists of an abstract wreath with small plants and blossoms on its inner perimeter with palmettes at each of the cardinal axes.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

Design for an Embroidered or Woven Fabric

label: Description
value: Boughs of various sizes. from very small to very big ones, and of various designs, are irregularly dispersed. A rising rinceau and a lace stripe are suggested at the right border. One spiral with a lace blossom of the rinceau is shown at the bottom, another with a lace leaf on top. A part of the lace stripe is shown in the interval. It shows leaf boughs on a netted ground.
